subject: Allow operator to disable usage of random-fully
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-08-27 01:04:25.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/conf/agent/common.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/iptables_manager.py', 'releasenotes/notes/use_random_fully-527b20bc524c308a.yaml'], 'message': 'Allow operator to disable usage of random-fully

In some specific use case, the cloud operator expects the source port
of a packet to stay the same across all masquerading layer up to the
destination host.   With the implementation of the random-fully code,
this behavior was changed as source_port is always rewritten no matter
which type of architecture / network CIDRs is being used in the backend.
This setting allows a user to fallback to the original behavior of the
masquerading process which is to keep the source_port consistent across
all layers.  The initial random-fully fix  prevents packet drops when
duplicate tuples are generated from two different namespace when the
source_ip:source_port goes toward the same destination so enabling this
setting would allow this issue to show again.   Perhaps a right approach
here would be to fix this "racey" situation in the kernel by perhaps
using the mac address as a seed to the tuple ...

Change-Id: Idfe5e51007b9a3eaa48779cd01edbca2f586eee5
Closes-bug: #1987396
(cherry picked from commit bbefe5285e7ab799422fab81488f57c9c22769b6)
(cherry picked from commit fa77abbc153dcf040a95f6a001d6661e07c25096)
'}]
commit_message:
Allow operator to disable usage of random-fully

In some specific use case, the cloud operator expects the source port
of a packet to stay the same across all masquerading layer up to the
destination host.   With the implementation of the random-fully code,
this behavior was changed as source_port is always rewritten no matter
which type of architecture / network CIDRs is being used in the backend.
This setting allows a user to fallback to the original behavior of the
masquerading process which is to keep the source_port consistent across
all layers.  The initial random-fully fix  prevents packet drops when
duplicate tuples are generated from two different namespace when the
source_ip:source_port goes toward the same destination so enabling this
setting would allow this issue to show again.   Perhaps a right approach
here would be to fix this "racey" situation in the kernel by perhaps
using the mac address as a seed to the tuple ...

Change-Id: Idfe5e51007b9a3eaa48779cd01edbca2f586eee5
Closes-bug: #1987396
(cherry picked from commit bbefe5285e7ab799422fab81488f57c9c22769b6)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 5572, 'name': 'Don Kehn', 'display_name': 'DEKehn', 'email': 'dekehn@gmail.com', 'username': 'dekehn'}, {'_account_id': 6994, 'name': 'Michael Chapman', 'email': 'woppin@gmail.com', 'username': 'michaeltchapman'}, {'_account_id': 10089, 'name': 'Anil Shashikumar Belur', 'email': 'askb23@gmail.com', 'username': 'askb'}, {'_account_id': 11628, 'name': 'Michael Johnson', 'email': 'johnsomor@gmail.com', 'username': 'johnsom'}, {'_account_id': 19298, 'name': 'Nicolas Bock', 'email': 'nicolas.bock@canonical.com', 'username': 'nicolasbock'}, {'_account_id': 20104, 'name': 'Dmitrii Galkin', 'display_name': 'Dmitry Galkin', 'email': 'galkindmitrii@gmail.com', 'username': 'galkindmitrii'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22623, 'name': 'Erik Olof Gunnar Andersson', 'email': 'eandersson@blizzard.com', 'username': 'eoandersson'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2022-08-15 07:44:00.000000000', 'files': ['designate/objects/rrdata_mx.py', 'designate/tests/unit/objects/test_rrdata_mx.py'], 'message': 'Validate MX records during recordset create or update

If invalid MX record is provided during recordset create command or
valid record is updated to invalid record using recordset set command,
causes recordset creation/updation failure. This leads to zone enter
in ERROR state and all further recordset creation calls fail. Validate
the records within recordset during create or update call.

Closes-Bug: #1927304
Change-Id: I0ace4d6c4ad6a6ee236e3af23805b01345d60a42
'}]
commit_message:
Validate MX records during recordset create or update

If invalid MX record is provided during recordset create command or
valid record is updated to invalid record using recordset set command,
causes recordset creation/updation failure. This leads to zone enter
in ERROR state and all further recordset creation calls fail. Validate
the records within recordset during create or update call.

Closes-Bug: #1927304
Change-Id: I0ace4d6c4ad6a6ee236e3af23805b01345d60a42

commit_message:
Set DC discovery-mode to 'none' if server is specified in SS.

If the user is configuring "Servers" as AD Server in the Security
Service then the domain controller discovery mode should be changed
to "none" and only these servers should be used.

Closes-bug: #1987537
Change-Id: I5cc181ac32529174e5e73dfde4604a470bd32442

commit_message:

commit_message:
mlnx: Allow workaround for duplicate resources

The commit b2e7de79df98a986768aaef203ddbe02bee41072 , which was merged
during Train cycle, introduced a few new parameters to support multi
interface driver, but the following two parameters are already declared
in the corresponding agent classes and trigger duplicate resource
declaration when these classes are used in a single manifest.
 - dhcp_broadcast_reply
 - interface_driver

This change allows users to workaround the problem. Details are
documented in the release note.

Closes-Bug: #1987460
Change-Id: I993523dc7f0ec8ad90a50d049dc0f5ccf9f2b191
(cherry picked from commit c4f3abe22e5f57a03c5953f0b342433d93f36731)

subject: Fix dependency to purge default vhost config
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2022-08-27 03:37:47.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/wsgi/apache.pp'], 'message': "Fix dependency to purge default vhost config

It turned out defining dependency for openstacklib::wsgi::apache
doesn't properly enforce resource order and the default vhost file
is not purged properly.
This change adds the more explicit dependency to enforce the order
properly.

Change-Id: I3c9afa0d9b0ef37ab56dd17136e4700b914de501
"}]
commit_message:
Fix dependency to purge default vhost config

It turned out defining dependency for openstacklib::wsgi::apache
doesn't properly enforce resource order and the default vhost file
is not purged properly.
This change adds the more explicit dependency to enforce the order
properly.

Change-Id: I3c9afa0d9b0ef37ab56dd17136e4700b914de501

subject: Remove redundant class inclusion
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2022-08-27 03:36:24.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/wsgi/apache.pp', 'spec/classes/glance_wsgi_apache_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Remove redundant class inclusion

The apache class is already included by the openstacklib::wsgi::apache
defined types and the apache::wsgi class and the apache::ssl class is
automatically included by the apache::vhost defined type.

This removes the redundant inclusion of these classes.

Change-Id: If132d46ec1929ed56e16a9b615010ea0535282ba
'}]
commit_message:
Remove redundant class inclusion

The apache class is already included by the openstacklib::wsgi::apache
defined types and the apache::wsgi class and the apache::ssl class is
automatically included by the apache::vhost defined type.

This removes the redundant inclusion of these classes.

Change-Id: If132d46ec1929ed56e16a9b615010ea0535282ba

commit_message:
DNM test new-deps workflow

This change cover the cases below:
- Added
  - new-dep
- Removed
  - pika
- Updated:
  - nvrs found:
    - patch already created: zeroconf [1]
    - patch not created: Pillow
  - nvrs not found:
    - croniter
  - module which version differs from py_vers: pecan
  - module which don't have distgit repo: Jinja2

Note: the chosen versions are just for mock purpose.

[1] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/deps/python-zeroconf/+/37149

Change-Id: I10561b78634271db77cb3af87671dd1bcefcb748

commit_message:
mlnx: Allow workaround for duplicate resources

The commit b2e7de79df98a986768aaef203ddbe02bee41072 , which was merged
during Train cycle, introduced a few new parameters to support multi
interface driver, but the following two parameters are already declared
in the corresponding agent classes and trigger duplicate resource
declaration when these classes are used in a single manifest.
 - dhcp_broadcast_reply
 - interface_driver

This change allows users to workaround the problem. Details are
documented in the release note.

Closes-Bug: #1987460
Change-Id: I993523dc7f0ec8ad90a50d049dc0f5ccf9f2b191

subject: Fix merge of multiple firewall rules
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 5756, 'name': 'Terry Wilson', 'email': 'twilson@redhat.com', 'username': 'otherwiseguy'}, {'_account_id': 6681, 'name': 'Brent Eagles', 'email': 'beagles@redhat.com', 'username': 'beagles'}, {'_account_id': 8833, 'name': 'Rabi Mishra', 'email': 'ramishra@redhat.com', 'username': 'rabi'}, {'_account_id': 9816, 'name': 'Takashi Kajinami', 'email': 'kajinamit@oss.nttdata.com', 'username': 'kajinamit'}, {'_account_id': 21798, 'name': 'Bernard Cafarelli', 'email': 'bcafarel@redhat.com', 'username': 'bcafarel'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-08-24 03:01:52.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/ovn/ovn-dbs-cluster-ansible.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix merge of multiple firewall rules

firewall_rules key for a rule was not unique which caused
map_merge to squash all dictionaries into one. This effectively
only applied iptable rule for the last cidr in the net_cidr list.
I am simply adding net_cidr into each rule key making it unique.
Alternatively, I could have removed map_merge but I think its
good to keep it incase there are multiple identical net_cidrs
(should not really happen)

Change-Id: I7ae92da25940f04ec91ad63c93c869b9a314df3b
'}]
commit_message:
Fix merge of multiple firewall rules

firewall_rules key for a rule was not unique which caused
map_merge to squash all dictionaries into one. This effectively
only applied iptable rule for the last cidr in the net_cidr list.
I am simply adding net_cidr into each rule key making it unique.
Alternatively, I could have removed map_merge but I think its
good to keep it incase there are multiple identical net_cidrs
(should not really happen)

Change-Id: I7ae92da25940f04ec91ad63c93c869b9a314df3b

commit_message:
Update requirements for python36

Support for python3.6 in cliff was dropped in v4.0.0, released August 12, 2022.
Warlock requires jsonschema > v4.
Since older versions of OpenStack still require py36 support, we need to add a constraint for py36.

Currently, this is blocking telemetry-dvsm-integration-centos-8s jobs on
yoga [1] [2]

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ceilometer/+/852878
(json_schema)
[2]
https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/618b46aea2ad4fd49b481263e28130b7
(cliff)

Change-Id: I25725a58c6c4b2198f6b83c43a52bcd33a42a8a3

subject: mlnx: Allow workaround for duplicate resources
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-08-24 00:55:07.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/bug-1987460-c5bfc6d98ccd3375.yaml', 'manifests/agents/ml2/mlnx.pp'], 'message': 'mlnx: Allow workaround for duplicate resources

The commit b2e7de79df98a986768aaef203ddbe02bee41072 , which was merged
during Train cycle, introduced a few new parameters to support multi
interface driver, but the following two parameters are already declared
in the corresponding agent classes and trigger duplicate resource
declaration when these classes are used in a single manifest.
 - dhcp_broadcast_reply

commit_message:
mlnx: Allow workaround for duplicate resources

The commit b2e7de79df98a986768aaef203ddbe02bee41072 , which was merged
during Train cycle, introduced a few new parameters to support multi
interface driver, but the following two parameters are already declared
in the corresponding agent classes and trigger duplicate resource
declaration when these classes are used in a single manifest.
 - dhcp_broadcast_reply
 - interface_driver

This change allows users to workaround the problem. Details are
documented in the release note.

Closes-Bug: #1987460
Change-Id: I993523dc7f0ec8ad90a50d049dc0f5ccf9f2b191

commit_message:
mlnx: Fix circular dependencies

This change fixes the following circular dependencies caused by
the commit db295da3d6ffc5c3065c9e52a5c8eb3d448ee32b , which fixed
the wrong plugin package name.

Anchor[neutron::config::begin]
  => File[/etc/neutron/plugin.ini]
  => Class[Neutron::Plugins::Ml2]
  => Class[Neutron::Plugins::Ml2::Mellanox]
  => Package[python3-networking-mlnx]
  => Anchor[neutron::install::end]
  => Anchor[neutron::config::begin]

Change-Id: I397172ad44ebe9e0c096a0bcc15781c1be2a2486

subject: Fix nova_libvirt_max_queues_set conditions for nova-compute
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6681, 'name': 'Brent Eagles', 'email': 'beagles@redhat.com', 'username': 'beagles'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 8833, 'name': 'Rabi Mishra', 'email': 'ramishra@redhat.com', 'username': 'rabi'}, {'_account_id': 9816, 'name': 'Takashi Kajinami', 'email': 'kajinamit@oss.nttdata.com', 'username': 'kajinamit'}, {'_account_id': 11604, 'name': 'sean mooney', 'email': 'smooney@redhat.com', 'username': 'sean-k-mooney'}, {'_account_id': 17216, 'name': 'Martin Schuppert', 'email': 'mschuppert@redhat.com', 'username': 'mcschupp'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 16, 'created': '2022-08-26 13:59:45.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/nova/nova-compute-container-puppet.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix nova_libvirt_max_queues_set conditions for nova-compute

A typical pattern to check for a feature gate by a param and its role
param (there are more types of checking, this one is for negation):
foo_gate_enabled:
  not:
    and:
      - equals: [{get_param: foo_val}, <null_val>]
      - equals: [{get_param: [RoleParameters, foo_val]}, <null_val>]

which is consider the feature gate OFF, only if both of its tht param
and role params are holding empty/falsey (null) values. If either holds
a not-null value, consider the condition is True, and treat the feature
gate as enabled.

For the nova compute service template, we follow that pattern when
checking permit_auto_converge_set, permit_post_copy_set,
reserved_huge_pages_set.

But we do not, when we check it for libvirt_file_backed_memory_enabled
and nova_libvirt_max_queues_set. And consider the feature disabled, if
*either of* the tht, or role param holds a null value. As a result,
when we define NovaLibvirtMaxQueues, or NovaLibvirtFileBackedMemory,
but have nothing for those in roles params, the features will not
become enabled.

Related: rhbz#1917460
Related: rhbz#1922819
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ie16ab2ab5836ed455aeda35d2ba619633a595411
'}]
commit_message:
Fix nova_libvirt_max_queues_set conditions for nova-compute

A typical pattern to check for a feature gate by a param and its role
param (there are more types of checking, this one is for negation):
foo_gate_enabled:
  not:
    and:
      - equals: [{get_param: foo_val}, <null_val>]
      - equals: [{get_param: [RoleParameters, foo_val]}, <null_val>]

which is consider the feature gate OFF, only if both of its tht param
and role params are holding empty/falsey (null) values. If either holds
a not-null value, consider the condition is True, and treat the feature
gate as enabled.

For the nova compute service template, we follow that pattern when
checking permit_auto_converge_set, permit_post_copy_set,
reserved_huge_pages_set.

But we do not, when we check it for libvirt_file_backed_memory_enabled
and nova_libvirt_max_queues_set. And consider the feature disabled, if
*either of* the tht, or role param holds a null value. As a result,
when we define NovaLibvirtMaxQueues, or NovaLibvirtFileBackedMemory,
but have nothing for those in roles params, the features will not
become enabled.

Related: rhbz#1917460
Related: rhbz#1922819
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ie16ab2ab5836ed455aeda35d2ba619633a595411

commit_message:
Use standard parameter description format for wsgi::apache

Currently parameter description of the <module>::wsgi::apache classes
are formatted differently in individual modules, and this is making
the maintenance effort quite difficult.

This change updates the description format following the standard one
we are globally using in our modules to reduce undesired differences
between modules.

commit_message:
Fix inconsistent parameter name of wsgi::apache

The placement::wsgi::apache class takes the api_port parameter to
determine the TCP port number, but this name is not commonly used while
the port parameter is used in the other modules. This change fixes
the parameter name so that we can keep the implementation more
consistent.

This also fixes minor differences mainly about formatting.

Change-Id: Ifaed2952e3dc49ee5cde2587bd5f8a35205465fb

commit_message:
Fix dependency to purge default vhost config

It turned out defining dependency for openstacklib::wsgi::apache
doesn't properly enforce resource order and the default vhost file
is not purged properly.
This change adds the more explicit dependency to enforce the order
properly.

commit_message:
Reconfigure amphora network interfaces seamlessly

Update amphora-interface app to allow reconfiguration of the network
interfaces without having to set them down first.

IP addresses/routes maintained by keepalived in Active/Standby topology
are now explicitly defined and marked as 'ignored' in the interface
files, allowing amphora-interface to not consider them as unused
addresses.

Add fixed_ips support on the VIP port, enabling the possibility to set
up many ip addresses on the VIP port

Story: 2005608
Task: 30847

Change-Id: If0b211b3ef4fce3b7a58823fc8d1e48448e4d346

commit_message:
Remove redundant resource order

The puppet-vswitch module already makes sure that the vs_config
resource automatically requires the openvswitch service. Thus defining
the same order is not necessary.

Change-Id: I8825a7438ba20be97da71acabd57604e7948e130

subject: vs_config: Fix broken idempotency with nil/empty value
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-08-27 15:54:24.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/vs_config/ovs.rb', 'spec/acceptance/basic_vswitch_spec.rb'], 'message': 'vs_config: Fix broken idempotency with nil/empty value

If the value is nil or empty then the option should NOT exist. This
change fixes the logic to determine whether the option already exists
which is causing broken idempotency.

Closes-Bug: #1987419
Change-Id: I56f85ca35f8e9ee4e5e8d07c714b65f655b1e9ae
(cherry picked from commit 10202ad22f70cbdf00401ff065f857edb500cc57)
'}]
commit_message:
vs_config: Fix broken idempotency with nil/empty value

If the value is nil or empty then the option should NOT exist. This
change fixes the logic to determine whether the option already exists
which is causing broken idempotency.

Closes-Bug: #1987419
Change-Id: I56f85ca35f8e9ee4e5e8d07c714b65f655b1e9ae
(cherry picked from commit 10202ad22f70cbdf00401ff065f857edb500cc57)

Remove redundant hard-coded defaults of oslo.messaging parameters

library, thus can be replaced by $::os_service_default.

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2022-08-26 07:52:44.000000000', 'files': ['ci/environments/scenario010-multinode-containers.yaml', 'deployment/octavia/octavia-base.yaml', 'ci/environments/scenario010-standalone.yaml', 'ci/environments/scenario013-standalone.yaml', 'deployment/octavia/octavia-api-container-puppet.yaml'], 'message': 'Octavia Jobboard integration

Add parameters for configuring Octavia Jobboard for the amphorav2
provider.

Jobboard for Octavia is enabled by the OctaviaEnableJobbard (default
false), Octavia is configured by puppet and THT creates an additional
database to store persistent objects managed by Octavia (dbname is
octavia_persistence).

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-tripleo/+/820668

Change-Id: Ia16b840ce63319375eddf860a4024c2ad47fab96
'}]
commit_message:
Octavia Jobboard integration

Add parameters for configuring Octavia Jobboard for the amphorav2
provider.

Jobboard for Octavia is enabled by the OctaviaEnableJobbard (default
false), Octavia is configured by puppet and THT creates an additional
database to store persistent objects managed by Octavia (dbname is
octavia_persistence).

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-tripleo/+/820668

Change-Id: Ia16b840ce63319375eddf860a4024c2ad47fab96

commit_message:
Fix remaining Secure RBAC policies

This patch fixes the remaining default policies to ensure they are only
evaluated when enforce_new_defaults=True.

The 'reader' role is removed from the policy tests in thise codebase
because they now correctly fail.

The 'reader' role in was introduced into the policy tests in
060ca2ee369af1fff3bf833d466f33d1889fb72e and the dynamic tests that were
generated passed because of the issue being resolved in this patch.

Now that the new default policies are not being evaluated when
enforce_new_defaults=False the requests using the 'reader' role are
correctly denied.

Story: 2010235
Task: 46122
Change-Id: Ief495c50bb120e2aa671dbcc80734ccb5a839b74
(cherry picked from commit 950420f3c91053564bd3bdb2ec2f021ee0f53446)
(cherry picked from commit 69307b024b98c990baa2ca3bf2044b773c1869e0)
(cherry picked from commit 74bab1d4254ed49d29f57eec2a66368ce966e287)

commit_message:
Ignore sealerts in CentOS 9 too

We already disable for CentOS8, let's do for CentOS9
too for same reasons.

Removed VERSION_ID check as both supported C8 and C9
need to be ignored, and same should be there for future
CentOS releases.

Change-Id: Ie84e91a7fed16cd727e8cd9c50066617a1cb23b7
(cherry picked from commit c218b2d33feb0adf847f76414eb1e0036b1451fe)

commit_message:
Ubuntu: Use non mirror host to pull puppetlabs packages

The latest puppetlabs-mysql release broke compatibility with puppet
< 6.24.0 [1][2]. However currently only 6.23.0 is available in infra
mirrors, and the integration jobs on Ubuntu are failing at quote early
stage while executing puppet.

[1] https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-mysql/commit/1c1291d2
[2] https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppet/commit/59d045b

This change switches to the upstream puppetlabs repo until the updated
puppet packages become available in mirrors.

Change-Id: I01a1141bcc1b05bf540f32444bfd2ba8cd8efcd6

commit_message:
lvm: Fix duplicate declaration with CentOS + tgtadm

The cinder::backend::iscsi defined resource type is used multiple times
when multiple lvm backends are used.

This change fixes duplicate declaration of file_line resource when
tgtadm is used instead of the default lioadm.

This also refactors resource definitions by ensure_resource/packages
function to ensure resource properties are set as expected.

Change-Id: I72181b3bae1a1ea5ec5453196b159fc55a52f6d3
(cherry picked from commit f496734bf229768c9aee2b6d650dc091fa4a633d)

After generating an inventory file in 'kayobe overcloud inventory

commit_message:
Fix IP allocation limit in overcloud inventory discover

After generating an inventory file in 'kayobe overcloud inventory
discover', the IP allocation playbook runs to allocate IP addresses for
the new hosts. Currently this runs without a limit, meaning it targets
all hosts. This change fixes it to use a limit of overcloud.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ic3a98fb9e741a2dea792b2e6cf6a6ff802d099a2

subject: RBD: Don't flatten temporary resources
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-06-08 13:04:49.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/rbd.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/test_rbd.py', 'releasenotes/notes/ceph-backup-no-flatten-36557727e9d73b2b.yaml'], 'message': "RBD: Don't flatten temporary resources

There are instances where cinder needs to create a temporary volume and
this can trigger a flatten of the new temporary volume, which will make
the operation take a lot longer.

In some cases this means slower operations, but in others it leads to
rpc timeout failures.

A case where we see timeout failures is when doing a backup of a
snapshot and we have rbd_flatten_volume_from_snapshot=true.

This patch ensures that we don't flatten temporary volumes.

Closes-Bug: #1916843
Change-Id: I8f55c3beb2f8df5b2227506f82ddf6ee57c951ae
(cherry picked from commit e726c07948138f514706cc69440971a2105c2bc0)
(cherry picked from commit 50c94ed0960e8bebbf5d17bac06c1646538f2fc2)
"}]
commit_message:
RBD: Don't flatten temporary resources

There are instances where cinder needs to create a temporary volume and
this can trigger a flatten of the new temporary volume, which will make
the operation take a lot longer.

In some cases this means slower operations, but in others it leads to
rpc timeout failures.

A case where we see timeout failures is when doing a backup of a
snapshot and we have rbd_flatten_volume_from_snapshot=true.

This patch ensures that we don't flatten temporary volumes.

Closes-Bug: #1916843
Change-Id: I8f55c3beb2f8df5b2227506f82ddf6ee57c951ae
(cherry picked from commit e726c07948138f514706cc69440971a2105c2bc0)
(cherry picked from commit 50c94ed0960e8bebbf5d17bac06c1646538f2fc2)

commit_message:
doc: clarify usage of use_multipath_for_image_xfer parameter

use_multipath_for_image_xfer and enforce_multipath_for_image_xfer need to be
used for each backend section or in [backend_defaults] section in cinder.conf
using it in default section will not have any effect.

This patch fixes multiple driver doc regarding use_multipath_for_image_xfer
and enforce_multipath_for_image_xfer parameter

also added same help text in driver.py so that the sample config file
indicates the same.

Change-Id: I5c9b3e5142833f276e10c432a7705a8cd118be7c
Closes-Bug: 1856612
(cherry picked from commit 59176660fdacc3eb79faccf69d95d2baed6d5fec)

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2022-08-25 14:17:50.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/functional/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/test_mech_driver.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/mech_driver.py'], 'message': '[OVN] Remove ACLs with remote SG during deletion of SG

When a security group is removed, the rules having this security

Conflicts:
    neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/mech_driver.py
    neutron/tests/functional/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/test_mech_driver.py

commit_message:
[OVN] Remove ACLs with remote SG during deletion of SG

When a security group is removed, the rules having this security
group as remote are removed. But the OVN ACL registers related
to those rules are not removed. This patch catches the security
group deletion precommit event to perform this cleanup.

Closes-Bug: #1983600

Conflicts:
    neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/mech_driver.py
    neutron/tests/functional/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/test_mech_driver.py

Change-Id: I6bb84cb748a2f80f2ff640ceeb3223413f7e92c7
(cherry picked from commit 1957353ef92ec11766a2ce3d29d51afa8d7fdb3e)

commit_message:
Reload vault on configure

Always reload reload on configure.
This ensures any certificates changed on disk will be reloaded.
(Such as the tcp listener certificate files.)

commit_message:
frr: Fix handling of NeutronBridgeMappings

The NeutronBridgeMappings parameter supports role specific definition
but the frr service template does not properly handle role specific
usage. This fixes it and makes sure the frr setting honors the role
specific definitions in addition to the global setting.

Change-Id: Ia3dda6b125e6a8ba64b4fff8cedaba78ee57a3fa

commit_message:
frr: Fix handling of NeutronBridgeMappings

The NeutronBridgeMappings parameter supports role specific definition
but the frr service template does not properly handle role specific
usage. This fixes it and makes sure the frr setting honors the role
specific definitions in addition to the global setting.

Conflicts:
	deployment/frr/frr-container-ansible.yaml

Backport note:
This backport also fixes the FrrOvnBgpAgentDriver parameter. Usage
of role specific definition was broken while the change was backported
to stable/wallaby by 5096c4757f23480b76a8170104a6809459ba6b9c .

Change-Id: Ia3dda6b125e6a8ba64b4fff8cedaba78ee57a3fa
(cherry picked from commit 980e1d6299a683ae4f14c3e1c0ee19c1d60d98ec)

subject: [OVN] Fix updating network segmentation ID
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2022-08-10 08:47:25.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/ovn_client.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/test_mech_driver.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_plugin.py', 'releasenotes/notes/ovn-update-vlan-id-749d8f17999243f5.yaml', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/mech_driver.py'], 'message': "[OVN] Fix updating network segmentation ID

The ML2/OVN driver wasn't handling updates to the segmentation ID for a
given network. This patch fixes this problem.

This patch extends the _update_segmentation_id() method to check on
drivers which does not inherits from AgentMechanismDriverBase, which
is the case of OVN (which inherits from MechanismDriver). A new method
is now called for those drivers to get a list of supported VIF types,
called get_supported_vif_types().

Closes-Bug: #1944708
Change-Id: Ibe08bfbc2efc55b9d628cdd0605941b7486186b6
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
[OVN] Fix updating network segmentation ID

The ML2/OVN driver wasn't handling updates to the segmentation ID for a
given network. This patch fixes this problem.

This patch extends the _update_segmentation_id() method to check on
drivers which does not inherits from AgentMechanismDriverBase, which
is the case of OVN (which inherits from MechanismDriver). A new method
is now called for those drivers to get a list of supported VIF types,
called get_supported_vif_types().

Closes-Bug: #1944708
Change-Id: Ibe08bfbc2efc55b9d628cdd0605941b7486186b6
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Ensure arp/ndp proxy is enabled on the needed bridges

The agent needs to enable the arp/ndp on the provider bridges that
are flat networks, or in the vlan device connected to the provider
bridges for vlan networks (instead of at the bridge directly)

Change-Id: Idbf5060ec1abbdb3f1a26c1ea6e313cdd809caf4

commit_message:
Set /run/podman ACL before starting collectd

When collectd sensubility is enabled, the collectd requires access to
/run/podman. This change adds a separate container to update ACL of
the path before starting the collectd container.

commit_message:
Retrieve the DSCP valid marks from the API

Instead of relying on a constant, read the DSCP valid supported marks
from the API, using the 'qos-rule-type-details' call [1].

[1]https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/network/v2/index.html?expanded=show-qos-rule-type-details-detail#show-qos-rule-type-details

commit_message:
DNM Force chrony sources online

NetworkManager can invoke onoffline which may offline the sources.
During the deployment let's force the sources online prior to waiting
for them to sync.

subject: Fix nova host-evacuate won't work with hostname is like a.b.c
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-08-18 10:24:50.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/v2/shell.py'], 'message': "Fix nova host-evacuate won't work with hostname is like a.b.c

nova-compute hostname is get by socket.hostname(), and it will return only the prefix of the hostname, for example, if the hostname if a.b.c, we get a.
the hypervisor_name id use the libvirt.getHostName function to get, and it will return the full name, for example, if the hostname if a.b.c, we get a.b.c
as a result, if we use nova host-evacuate to evacuate node a, it won't find the hypervisor node a because of its' full hypervisor name if a.b.c。

close-bug: 1986931
Change-Id: I4866ad6b084e0b4dcb86164b117922bb14f97dbc
"}]
commit_message:
Fix nova host-evacuate won't work with hostname is like a.b.c

nova-compute hostname is get by socket.hostname(), and it will return only the prefix of the hostname, for example, if the hostname if a.b.c, we get a.
the hypervisor_name id use the libvirt.getHostName function to get, and it will return the full name, for example, if the hostname if a.b.c, we get a.b.c
as a result, if we use nova host-evacuate to evacuate node a, it won't find the hypervisor node a because of its' full hypervisor name if a.b.c。

close-bug: 1986931
Change-Id: I4866ad6b084e0b4dcb86164b117922bb14f97dbc

subject: Use standard parameter description format for wsgi::apache
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-08-27 03:37:40.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/wsgi/apache.pp'], 'message': 'Use standard parameter description format for wsgi::apache

Currently parameter description of the <module>::wsgi::apache classes
are formatted differently in individual modules, and this is making
the maintenance effort quite difficult.

This change updates the description format following the standard one
we are globally using in our modules to reduce undesired differences
between modules.

Change-Id: Ic19381c0beeca3c7b62db6345157cd6aab5b3105
'}]
commit_message:
Use standard parameter description format for wsgi::apache

Currently parameter description of the <module>::wsgi::apache classes
are formatted differently in individual modules, and this is making
the maintenance effort quite difficult.

This change updates the description format following the standard one
we are globally using in our modules to reduce undesired differences
between modules.

Change-Id: Ic19381c0beeca3c7b62db6345157cd6aab5b3105

commit_message:
Fix FIPS job - nslookup_target

This patch sets a zuul variable "nslookup_target" to 'opendev.org'
to fix the FIPS jobs.

The nslookup_target var was added as a required var for the enable-fips
role in [1].

[1] https://opendev.org/zuul/zuul-jobs/commit/25caf7ef5e5801892ed575b063824ffb8355fb1e

Change-Id: Ifb0f929cf7cb9dddedcf4f0bd930b4bd7ca2dd72

commit_message:
Run northd services as root user

When running from OVN_BRANCH main/master and build from
source enabled. After [1], by default, --ovn-user is not
defined to ovnctl on startup and it will run as root user.
As some other services are created as STACK_USER some
operations fails due to permission error later.

[1] https://github.com/ovn-org/ovn/commit/49b456e4b75debb29bcf8d4915d535904924edff

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/854190

Change-Id: I5f375ae80798fc7673e450010d504a9cc6b990ed

subject: Mock getaddrinfo in cinder store tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-08-09 14:21:52.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/functional/v2/test_legacy_update_cinder_store.py'], 'message': "Mock getaddrinfo in cinder store tests

With change Ic79815972e654a8bfe2775f57c68cfa0bf115e2f, we started
using getaddrinfo method from socket lib to fetch the system
IP address (v4 or v6) and pass it to os-brick.
The test works for most systems since a valid IP is returned but
for some deployments, it fails with the following error.

raise socket.gaierror(socket.EAI_NONAME, 'No address found')

In any case, it is a good practice to mock it in tests.
This patch mocks getaddrinfo in the current cinder store tests.

Change-Id: Ib03fefbb6034a7e7d2ff1e16430d28962c2ca355
(cherry picked from commit f40ac40c2c40d57637312959b680121a9c89949a)
"}]
commit_message:
Mock getaddrinfo in cinder store tests

With change Ic79815972e654a8bfe2775f57c68cfa0bf115e2f, we started
using getaddrinfo method from socket lib to fetch the system
IP address (v4 or v6) and pass it to os-brick.
The test works for most systems since a valid IP is returned but
for some deployments, it fails with the following error.

raise socket.gaierror(socket.EAI_NONAME, 'No address found')

In any case, it is a good practice to mock it in tests.
This patch mocks getaddrinfo in the current cinder store tests.

Change-Id: Ib03fefbb6034a7e7d2ff1e16430d28962c2ca355
(cherry picked from commit f40ac40c2c40d57637312959b680121a9c89949a)

commit_message:
Heat: Present policy rules for all services

The policy rules are used not only by heat-api but also by heat-api-cfn
and heat-engine. This change ensures the policy rules defined by
the HeatApiPolicies parameter is rendered into hieradata in the node
where these heat services are running, even if these services run on
separate nodes.

Change-Id: Ic278c69110d427118c5ff9b4bddc72493434154a
Closes-Bug: #1983342
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/851803

commit_message:
Ensure members without subnet belong to VIP subnet or fail

This patch ensures the members without subnet are only accepted
if the IP of the member belongs to the CIDR of the VIP subnet,
as that is the subnet associated to the loadbalancer used to
obtain the subnet for the members that do not have it.

Closes-Bug: #1982111

(manually cherry picked from commit 136b829579e83618b8497963153edff1de320e6b)

Change-Id: I0fd90c9329a2ec43823813542f263845562c45f2
(cherry picked from commit 136b829579e83618b8497963153edff1de320e6b)

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2022-08-12 05:56:35.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/bug-1976499-storwize-lsfcportsetmember_is_being_called_in_the_wrong_SVC_code_level-db06c4eca902f389.yaml', 'cinder/volume/drivers/ibm/storwize_svc/storwize_svc_common.py'], 'message': "[SVf] : Fix the SVC code level for lsfcportsetmember call

[Spectrum Virtualize family] lsfcportsetmember call was
introduced in SVC code level 8.5.x. But during portset implementation,
lsfcportsetmember was included in 8.4.2.0 which is incorrect as SVC
8.4.2.0 doesn't recognise this command.

Correcting the SVC code level for lsfcportsetmember call.

Closes-Bug: #1976499
Change-Id: Ia9f22d630ff9d9541bb36e5506679dd15c27d5d5
"}]
commit_message:
[SVf] : Fix the SVC code level for lsfcportsetmember call

[Spectrum Virtualize family] lsfcportsetmember call was
introduced in SVC code level 8.5.x. But during portset implementation,
lsfcportsetmember was included in 8.4.2.0 which is incorrect as SVC
8.4.2.0 doesn't recognise this command.

Correcting the SVC code level for lsfcportsetmember call.

Closes-Bug: #1976499
Change-Id: Ia9f22d630ff9d9541bb36e5506679dd15c27d5d5

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2022-08-08 13:01:50.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/dell_emc/powermax/iscsi.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/dell_emc/powermax/test_powermax_fc.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/dell_emc/powerflex/driver.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/dell_emc/powermax/test_powermax_iscsi.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/dell_emc/powermax/common.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/dell_emc/powerstore/driver.py', 'releasenotes/notes/demc-trim-bb2165f74a5703a6.yaml', 'cinder/volume/drivers/dell_emc/powerstore/adapter.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/dell_emc/powermax/fc.py'], 'message': "DEMC: Add support for trim/discard

This patch adds support for trim/discard to 3 Dell EMC drivers:

- PowerStore
- PowerMax
- PowerFlex

Support is added to report this capability to both Nova, via the
'discard' value in connection properties, as well as internally to
Cinder, via the 'sparse_copy_volume' driver capability.

PowerStore and PowerMax only support thin volumes, so they will always
report the trimming capability, but the PowerFlex also supports thick
volumes, so it will only be returned for thin volumes, and following
vendor's recommendation [1] it will not be returned for volumes that
have snapshots.

SysAdmins can force all volumes to return discard capabilities for Nova
with the ``report_discard_supported`` configuration option.

[1]: https://docs.delltechnologies.com/bundle/READY_NODE_AMS_DG/page/GUID-8E6676C1-425A-4D51-8F59-1A92DE4F6638.html

Change-Id: Ib119fd689545bdb636a4844c6125aec7c3c24b96
"}]
commit_message:
DEMC: Add support for trim/discard

This patch adds support for trim/discard to 3 Dell EMC drivers:

- PowerStore
- PowerMax
- PowerFlex

Support is added to report this capability to both Nova, via the
'discard' value in connection properties, as well as internally to
Cinder, via the 'sparse_copy_volume' driver capability.

PowerStore and PowerMax only support thin volumes, so they will always
report the trimming capability, but the PowerFlex also supports thick
volumes, so it will only be returned for thin volumes, and following
vendor's recommendation [1] it will not be returned for volumes that
have snapshots.

SysAdmins can force all volumes to return discard capabilities for Nova
with the ``report_discard_supported`` configuration option.

[1]: https://docs.delltechnologies.com/bundle/READY_NODE_AMS_DG/page/GUID-8E6676C1-425A-4D51-8F59-1A92DE4F6638.html

Change-Id: Ib119fd689545bdb636a4844c6125aec7c3c24b96

subject: NetApp SolidFire: Fix RecursionError accessing undefined attributes
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4523, 'name': 'Eric Harney', 'email': 'eharney@redhat.com', 'username': 'eharney'}, {'_account_id': 7198, 'name': 'Jay Bryant', 'email': 'jungleboyj@electronicjungle.net', 'username': 'jsbryant'}, {'_account_id': 12670, 'name': 'Helen Walsh', 'email': 'helen.walsh@emc.com', 'username': 'walshh2'}, {'_account_id': 20813, 'name': 'Sofia Enriquez', 'email': 'lsofia.enriquez@gmail.com', 'username': 'enriquetaso'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 27615, 'name': 'Rajat Dhasmana', 'email': 'rajatdhasmana@gmail.com', 'username': 'whoami-rajat'}, {'_account_id': 30555, 'name': 'Fernando Ferraz', 'display_name': 'Fernando Ferraz', 'email': 'fesilva@redhat.com', 'username': 'fernandoperches'}, {'_account_id': 30615, 'name': 'Tushar Trambak Gite', 'email': 'tushargite96@gmail.com', 'username': 'tushargite96'}, {'_account_id': 31721, 'name': 'Felipe Rodrigues', 'email': 'felipefuty01@gmail.com', 'username': 'felipefutty'}, {'_account_id': 32029, 'name': 'likui', 'email': 'likui@yovole.com', 'username': 'likui'}, {'_account_id': 32761, 'name': 'panhongyin', 'display_name': 'panhongyin', 'email': 'panhongyin@yovole.com', 'username': 'panhongyin'}, {'_account_id': 33301, 'name': 'Caique Mello', 'email': 'caiquemellosbo@gmail.com', 'username': 'MelloCaique'}, {'_account_id': 33648, 'name': 'Nahim Alves de Souza', 'email': 'nahimsouza@outlook.com', 'username': 'nahimsouza'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2022-08-04 13:22:17.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/solidfire.py', 'releasenotes/notes/netapp-solidfire-fix-osprofiler-infinite-recursion-ec3d4794c89b2f83.yaml'], 'message': "NetApp SolidFire: Fix RecursionError accessing undefined attributes

A RecursionError exception can occur in the SolidFire driver when
accessing a Driver class attribute that does not exist in both
SolidFireDriver and SolidFireISCSI classes.

The SolidFireDriver class (the driver's entry point) implements
__getattr__ so that a call to a missing attribute is redirected to
its complementary class SolidFireISCSI. The problem is that
SolidFireISCSI class was also implemented in the same way, looking
for attributes in SolidFireDriver in case it doesn't provide a
definition. So a call to an attribute that does not exist in both
classes leads to a class trying to find the attribute in the other,
in an endless loop situation.

Applications such as OSProfiler may hit this scenario by inspecting
the SolidFire driver class instance at  driver's initialization and
causing its failure.

This patch fixes the issue by removing __getattr__ implementation
from SolidFireISCSI, allowing the driver to return
NotImplementedError exception correctly.

Change-Id: Ic611b2abf11b94f9a21353df426cda19c09bf085
Closes-Bug: 1934459
"}]
commit_message:
NetApp SolidFire: Fix RecursionError accessing undefined attributes

A RecursionError exception can occur in the SolidFire driver when
accessing a Driver class attribute that does not exist in both
SolidFireDriver and SolidFireISCSI classes.

The SolidFireDriver class (the driver's entry point) implements
__getattr__ so that a call to a missing attribute is redirected to
its complementary class SolidFireISCSI. The problem is that
SolidFireISCSI class was also implemented in the same way, looking
for attributes in SolidFireDriver in case it doesn't provide a
definition. So a call to an attribute that does not exist in both
classes leads to a class trying to find the attribute in the other,
in an endless loop situation.

Applications such as OSProfiler may hit this scenario by inspecting
the SolidFire driver class instance at  driver's initialization and
causing its failure.

This patch fixes the issue by removing __getattr__ implementation
from SolidFireISCSI, allowing the driver to return
NotImplementedError exception correctly.

Change-Id: Ic611b2abf11b94f9a21353df426cda19c09bf085
Closes-Bug: 1934459

commit_message:
Drop python3.6/3.7 support in testing runtime

In Zed cycle testing runtime, we are targetting to drop the
python 3.6/3.7 support, project started adding python 3.8 as minimum,

example nova:
- https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/56b5aed08c6a3ed81b78dc216f0165ebfe3c3350/setup.cfg#L13

Also moving zuul jobs to Zed.
Also indicate that we support py3.9

Change-Id: Ifb6188b4e623d40bcadb3c92462024f80616291d

move victoria's zuul jobs to zed

Change-Id: I0200db8add157d28a0bc0859ea126b2e4711f75e

Previously since the method used to get vnf package when creating

This patch fixes to use the method that is tenant aware to get

Change-Id: I0de5323fc1dc58f52ea2e3d3d72fa4c0c41f0acd
'}]
commit_message:
make getting vnf package tenant aware

Previously since the method used to get vnf package when creating
vnf instance in v2 API is not tenant aware, it fails when a user
who does not have admin role executes the API.

This patch fixes to use the method that is tenant aware to get
vnf package.

Closes-Bug: #1981771
Change-Id: I0de5323fc1dc58f52ea2e3d3d72fa4c0c41f0acd

commit_message:
Pin puppetlabs-mysql to 12.0.3

The latest puppetlabs-mysql release broke compatibility with puppet
< 6.24.0 [1][2]. However currently only 6.23.0 is available for Ubuntu
Focal and the integration jobs on Ubuntu are failing at quote early
stage while executing puppet.

[1] https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-mysql/commit/1c1291d2
[2] https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppet/commit/59d045b

This temporarily downgrade puppetlabs-mysql until we get a newer
version of puppet package for Ubuntu.

Change-Id: I792dbb9027c0559c76b448a643dfe28fb74d4443

subject: RBD: Improve IOWrapper's close & flush methods
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2022-08-24 19:46:28.000000000', 'files': ['os_brick/initiator/linuxrbd.py', 'os_brick/tests/initiator/test_linuxrbd.py'], 'message': 'RBD: Improve IOWrapper's close & flush methods

The RBDVolumeIOWrapper class inherits from io.RawIOBase but its close
method doesn't flush and after being called the "closed" attribute still
returns False.

Trying to set the "closed" attribute ourselves in
RBDVolumeIOWrapper.close results in an error, so we call the parent's
implementation to do it.

The parent's close method will also call the flush method.

This change ensures that rbd_image.close is only called once, that the
closed attribute is correct, and that the data is flushed on close.

Without these changes we could have, unintentionally, multiple calls to
the rbd_image.close method.  If we called close on the wrapper
ourselves, then when the Garbage Collector is cleaning up the wrapper it
will call the io.RawIOBase finalizer that will see that the file is not
closed and call close again.

Now that we correctly set the closed flag on the instance, the flush
method should also behave like the parent implementation and fail if it
has already been closed.

Change-Id: Ib3b066a7da071b1c2de78a1a4e569676539bd335
'}]
commit_message:
RBD: Improve IOWrapper's close & flush methods

The RBDVolumeIOWrapper class inherits from io.RawIOBase but its close
method doesn't flush and after being called the "closed" attribute still
returns False.

Trying to set the "closed" attribute ourselves in
RBDVolumeIOWrapper.close results in an error, so we call the parent's
implementation to do it.

The parent's close method will also call the flush method.

This change ensures that rbd_image.close is only called once, that the
closed attribute is correct, and that the data is flushed on close.

Without these changes we could have, unintentionally, multiple calls to
the rbd_image.close method.  If we called close on the wrapper
ourselves, then when the Garbage Collector is cleaning up the wrapper it
will call the io.RawIOBase finalizer that will see that the file is not
closed and call close again.

Now that we correctly set the closed flag on the instance, the flush
method should also behave like the parent implementation and fail if it
has already been closed.

Change-Id: Ib3b066a7da071b1c2de78a1a4e569676539bd335

subject: Allow passing explicit microversions to Resource methods
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2022-08-23 14:19:55.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/object_store/v1/obj.py', 'openstack/tests/unit/test_resource.py', 'openstack/resource.py'], 'message': 'Allow passing explicit microversions to Resource methods

Sometimes users may want a specific behavior of a certain microversion
rather than just the most recent supported one. For example, Ironic only
supports creating nodes directly in the "available" state before 1.11.

Change-Id: I2458650a9ce30440b5e29b940eaf1df60239ff32
'}]
commit_message:
Allow passing explicit microversions to Resource methods

Sometimes users may want a specific behavior of a certain microversion
rather than just the most recent supported one. For example, Ironic only
supports creating nodes directly in the "available" state before 1.11.

Change-Id: I2458650a9ce30440b5e29b940eaf1df60239ff32

commit_message:
mlnx: Deprecate duplicate parameters

This change deprecates the parameters which are conflicting with
other service classes such as neutron::agents::dhcp, so that we can
remove these parameters completely in a future release.

Related-Bug: #1987460
Change-Id: I2ed2241b304bf2280112b4f6beaff36975500f5e

subject: Allow operator to disable usage of random-fully
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-08-26 13:17:34.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/conf/agent/common.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/iptables_manager.py', 'releasenotes/notes/use_random_fully-527b20bc524c308a.yaml'], 'message': 'Allow operator to disable usage of random-fully

In some specific use case, the cloud operator expects the source port
of a packet to stay the same across all masquerading layer up to the
destination host.   With the implementation of the random-fully code,
this behavior was changed as source_port is always rewritten no matter
which type of architecture / network CIDRs is being used in the backend.
This setting allows a user to fallback to the original behavior of the
masquerading process which is to keep the source_port consistent across
all layers.  The initial random-fully fix  prevents packet drops when
duplicate tuples are generated from two different namespace when the
source_ip:source_port goes toward the same destination so enabling this
setting would allow this issue to show again.   Perhaps a right approach
here would be to fix this "racey" situation in the kernel by perhaps
using the mac address as a seed to the tuple ...

Change-Id: Idfe5e51007b9a3eaa48779cd01edbca2f586eee5
Closes-bug: #1987396
(cherry picked from commit bbefe5285e7ab799422fab81488f57c9c22769b6)
'}]
commit_message:
Allow operator to disable usage of random-fully

In some specific use case, the cloud operator expects the source port
of a packet to stay the same across all masquerading layer up to the
destination host.   With the implementation of the random-fully code,
this behavior was changed as source_port is always rewritten no matter
which type of architecture / network CIDRs is being used in the backend.
This setting allows a user to fallback to the original behavior of the
masquerading process which is to keep the source_port consistent across
all layers.  The initial random-fully fix  prevents packet drops when
duplicate tuples are generated from two different namespace when the
source_ip:source_port goes toward the same destination so enabling this
setting would allow this issue to show again.   Perhaps a right approach
here would be to fix this "racey" situation in the kernel by perhaps
using the mac address as a seed to the tuple ...

Change-Id: Idfe5e51007b9a3eaa48779cd01edbca2f586eee5
Closes-bug: #1987396
(cherry picked from commit bbefe5285e7ab799422fab81488f57c9c22769b6)

subject: Update ovmf-amdsev from ovmf-cc to boot UEFI VMs
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4571, 'name': 'Steve Baker', 'email': 'sbaker@redhat.com', 'username': 'steve-stevebaker'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 6962, 'name': 'Kashyap Chamarthy', 'email': 'kchamart@redhat.com', 'username': 'kashyapc'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 9816, 'name': 'Takashi Kajinami', 'email': 'kajinamit@oss.nttdata.com', 'username': 'kajinamit'}, {'_account_id': 11604, 'name': 'sean mooney', 'email': 'smooney@redhat.com', 'username': 'sean-k-mooney'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2022-08-24 14:01:55.000000000', 'files': ['container-images/tcib/base/os/nova-base/nova-libvirt/nova-libvirt.yaml', 'container-images/tcib/base/os/nova-base/nova-compute/nova-compute.yaml'], 'message': "Update ovmf-amdsev from ovmf-cc to boot UEFI VMs

Fix for a package was expected in edk2-20220526git16779ede2d36-2.el9,
but it's not there yet.

Without this fix, Nova cannot boot UEFI instances for x86_64 arch because
there is no nvram-template data in
/usr/share/qemu/firmware/edk2-ovmf-amdsev.json.

Symlinking it from /usr/share/qemu/firmware/edk2-ovmf-cc.json would be
quick and dirty w/a but it's better to merge the nvram-template into
it. This way other amdsev-specific feautes would be preserved.

Provide that merging data w/a for nova virtqemud containers build
scripts, until it is fixed in centos-stream9 and rhel9 packaging.

Nova compute also reads those ovmf files, so apply the w/a to
nova compute TCIB as well. It is not clear where from these files
come into nova compute container (edk2-ovmf is only installed in
the libvirt virtqemud container, and no packages require it in
RDO), so for safety reasons, add a quarding check for the source file
presense.

Change-Id: Ieaacb67d16e82e9c34fcfb31398da5a95cdc3d43
Related: rhbz#2090752
Related: rhbz#2109644
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Update ovmf-amdsev from ovmf-cc to boot UEFI VMs

Fix for a package was expected in edk2-20220526git16779ede2d36-2.el9,
but it's not there yet.

Without this fix, Nova cannot boot UEFI instances for x86_64 arch because
there is no nvram-template data in
/usr/share/qemu/firmware/edk2-ovmf-amdsev.json.

Symlinking it from /usr/share/qemu/firmware/edk2-ovmf-cc.json would be
quick and dirty w/a but it's better to merge the nvram-template into
it. This way other amdsev-specific feautes would be preserved.

Provide that merging data w/a for nova virtqemud containers build
scripts, until it is fixed in centos-stream9 and rhel9 packaging.

Nova compute also reads those ovmf files, so apply the w/a to
nova compute TCIB as well. It is not clear where from these files
come into nova compute container (edk2-ovmf is only installed in
the libvirt virtqemud container, and no packages require it in
RDO), so for safety reasons, add a quarding check for the source file
presense.

Change-Id: Ieaacb67d16e82e9c34fcfb31398da5a95cdc3d43
Related: rhbz#2090752
Related: rhbz#2109644
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Update volume and volume transfer schema

Fix the volume transfers client so that it supports microversions,
by deriving from the volume service's base client.

Define volume transfer schema for mv 3.55 and 3.57, and
volume schema for mv 3.65 and 3.69.

Change-Id: I4ad7fe336c5193604d95fca5a72695d82adaa9f0

subject: Attach and detach an SR-IOV port
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2022-08-25 20:17:25.000000000', 'files': ['whitebox_tempest_plugin/api/compute/test_sriov.py', 'whitebox_tempest_plugin/api/compute/test_vgpu.py', 'whitebox_tempest_plugin/config.py', 'whitebox_tempest_plugin/hardware.py'], 'message': 'Attach and detach an SR-IOV port

Adds test support for attaching/detaching SR-IOV ports to guests. [1]
These tests pull from the original tempest format [2] from
AttachInterfacesTestJSON.test_reassign_port_between_servers. It adds
additional checks around the guest XML as well as checking within the
guest for the SR-IOV vendor/device id.

Commit also moves _get_pci_addr_from_device from vgpu to hardware.py to
allow it to be called from different tests beyond vgpu.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1685152
[2] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/master/tempest/api/compute/servers/test_attach_interfaces.py#L295

Change-Id: I340fd6486b0a179830e6e559281adc257fefb4bd
'}]
commit_message:
Attach and detach an SR-IOV port

Adds test support for attaching/detaching SR-IOV ports to guests. [1]
These tests pull from the original tempest format [2] from
AttachInterfacesTestJSON.test_reassign_port_between_servers. It adds
additional checks around the guest XML as well as checking within the
guest for the SR-IOV vendor/device id.

Commit also moves _get_pci_addr_from_device from vgpu to hardware.py to
allow it to be called from different tests beyond vgpu.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1685152
[2] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/master/tempest/api/compute/servers/test_attach_interfaces.py#L295

Change-Id: I340fd6486b0a179830e6e559281adc257fefb4bd

subject: Exclude .cache when running flake8
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-08-26 19:54:15.000000000', 'files': ['.gitignore', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Exclude .cache when running flake8

For local runs of testenv:linters we cache all the external Ansible
playbooks and roles ansible-lint will need to reference in order to
validate content in this repository. We build that cache in a .cache
directory, but not everything in the cached repositories is suitable
for flake8 checking, so add that directory to its exclusion list.

Also add the same directory to .gitignore, so Git will stop
complaining about it being untracked.

Change-Id: I1f740edd75cc7f6ba0f4a73f0a409a620b437b16
'}]
commit_message:
Exclude .cache when running flake8

For local runs of testenv:linters we cache all the external Ansible
playbooks and roles ansible-lint will need to reference in order to
validate content in this repository. We build that cache in a .cache
directory, but not everything in the cached repositories is suitable
for flake8 checking, so add that directory to its exclusion list.

Also add the same directory to .gitignore, so Git will stop
complaining about it being untracked.

Change-Id: I1f740edd75cc7f6ba0f4a73f0a409a620b437b16

We make a lot of ShardRange objects, pretty much all the time.  Try to
make it a little better:

  * Add __slots__ to improve memory consumption and attribute lookups.
  * Avoid the overhead of catch_warnings() by not tripping the warning.

Change-Id: Ib1c698be9e9f579649bc81acf3562c92feb6c8d3

commit_message:
Optimize ShardRanges a little

We make a lot of ShardRange objects, pretty much all the time.  Try to
make it a little better:

  * Add __slots__ to improve memory consumption and attribute lookups.
  * Avoid the overhead of catch_warnings() by not tripping the warning.

Change-Id: Ib1c698be9e9f579649bc81acf3562c92feb6c8d3

subject: Capture requests errors
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-08-25 15:32:52.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/catch-general-requests-exceptions-b5fd706597708fb6.yaml', 'sushy/connector.py', 'sushy/tests/unit/test_connector.py'], 'message': 'Capture requests errors

Situations can occur where rare exceptions can originate
from within python requests, which are not captured or handled
in Sushy.

Example: Encoding errors should trigger some sort of recovery,
but cached session clients cannot recover, and power synchronization
for users, such as Ironic, break on the cached session when they
attempt to access them for the same task, again.

Change-Id: I0f79083d41b0b7ccf7e4dbfc81fd1d42c2e5eb15
(cherry picked from commit b855365ef0aa77924ec7a39952bc3ebdd1922f97)
(cherry picked from commit 1ae8e49d4f63efb13ae75aff5a7d0969de92f02f)
'}]
commit_message:
Capture requests errors

Situations can occur where rare exceptions can originate
from within python requests, which are not captured or handled
in Sushy.

Example: Encoding errors should trigger some sort of recovery,
but cached session clients cannot recover, and power synchronization
for users, such as Ironic, break on the cached session when they
attempt to access them for the same task, again.

Change-Id: I0f79083d41b0b7ccf7e4dbfc81fd1d42c2e5eb15
(cherry picked from commit b855365ef0aa77924ec7a39952bc3ebdd1922f97)
(cherry picked from commit 1ae8e49d4f63efb13ae75aff5a7d0969de92f02f)

subject: Do not send compression as acceptable encoding
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-08-25 15:34:50.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/do-not-offer-compression-encoding-884ca8a7458cb096.yaml', 'sushy/connector.py'], 'message': 'Do not send compression as acceptable encoding

When a BMC can compress a response, the internal server... or any
intermediate proxy may change a "Strong" ETag to a "Weak" ETag, as
the strength of the ETag represents the byte-by-byte consistency of the
response body.

Compressed responses may differ slightly, especially if different encoding
is used or negotiated. This is problematic when a resource expects a
follow-up request or action to contain a "Strong" ETag as it is the client
certifying it understood the prior precise state.

We no longer request opportunistic response encoding, and expressly request
responses are not modified or compressed by the intermediate server, which
should have a minimal impact to use and provide a higher level of BMC
interaction consistency.

Change-Id: Idb2d6bee96bd23cfc4fb8f014661231766998781
(cherry picked from commit 51dacf272f4d0f3e346c69e94786da2b7ee7c935)
(cherry picked from commit 021e0175e2ffc7c31e7052fb3bc39c9e28b83783)
(cherry picked from commit cff4cc1cbe9f2196dccc5c6ee990b2cc66a9f3a4)
'}]
commit_message:
Do not send compression as acceptable encoding

When a BMC can compress a response, the internal server... or any
intermediate proxy may change a "Strong" ETag to a "Weak" ETag, as
the strength of the ETag represents the byte-by-byte consistency of the
response body.

Compressed responses may differ slightly, especially if different encoding
is used or negotiated. This is problematic when a resource expects a
follow-up request or action to contain a "Strong" ETag as it is the client
certifying it understood the prior precise state.

We no longer request opportunistic response encoding, and expressly request
responses are not modified or compressed by the intermediate server, which
should have a minimal impact to use and provide a higher level of BMC
interaction consistency.

Change-Id: Idb2d6bee96bd23cfc4fb8f014661231766998781
(cherry picked from commit 51dacf272f4d0f3e346c69e94786da2b7ee7c935)
(cherry picked from commit 021e0175e2ffc7c31e7052fb3bc39c9e28b83783)
(cherry picked from commit cff4cc1cbe9f2196dccc5c6ee990b2cc66a9f3a4)

Change-Id: I40c3fc822e8ea9ef0eca8c15afe0d12b8bc926ff

commit_message:
Distinguish between port number of internal endpoint and binding
port number in cinder

Now binding ports of service and pod spec are configured using
internal endpoint values.
To support reverse proxy for internalUrl, need to distinguish
between binding ports and internal endpoint ports.

I added `service` section in endpoint items apart from admin,public
,internal and default.

Change-Id: I40c3fc822e8ea9ef0eca8c15afe0d12b8bc926ff

commit_message:
Ensure members without subnet belong to VIP subnet or fail

This patch ensures the members without subnet are only accepted
if the IP of the member belongs to the CIDR of the VIP subnet,
as that is the subnet associated to the loadbalancer used to
obtain the subnet for the members that do not have it.

Closes-Bug: #1982111

(manually cherry picked from commit 136b829579e83618b8497963153edff1de320e6b)

Change-Id: I0fd90c9329a2ec43823813542f263845562c45f2
(cherry picked from commit 136b829579e83618b8497963153edff1de320e6b)

subject: Fix software raid output poisoning
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-08-25 15:25:08.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_python_agent/hardware.py', 'releasenotes/notes/fix-softraid-name-poisoning-4e934dd4e60830b1.yaml', 'ironic_python_agent/tests/unit/test_hardware.py', 'ironic_python_agent/tests/unit/samples/hardware_samples.py'], 'message': 'Fix software raid output poisoning

In the event a device name is set to contain a raid device path,
it is possible for the Name and Events field values of mdadm's
detailed output to contain text which inadvertently gets captured and
mapped as component data for the "holder" devices of the RAID set.

This would cause invalid values to get passed to UEFI methods
which would cause a deployment to fail under these circumstances.

We now ignore the Name and Events fields in mdadm output.

Change-Id: If721dfe1caa5915326482969e55fbf4697538231
(cherry picked from commit f3e3de8097f05cc830768da7d3f3e9eae04b40a1)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix software raid output poisoning

In the event a device name is set to contain a raid device path,
it is possible for the Name and Events field values of mdadm's
detailed output to contain text which inadvertently gets captured and
mapped as component data for the "holder" devices of the RAID set.

This would cause invalid values to get passed to UEFI methods
which would cause a deployment to fail under these circumstances.

We now ignore the Name and Events fields in mdadm output.

Change-Id: If721dfe1caa5915326482969e55fbf4697538231
(cherry picked from commit f3e3de8097f05cc830768da7d3f3e9eae04b40a1)

subject: Fix test_get_console_output_server_id_in_shutoff_status
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2020-09-03 09:01:10.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/servers/test_server_actions.py'], 'message': 'Fix test_get_console_output_server_id_in_shutoff_status

the test was not actually testing what it was meant to:

it creates its own server (not re-using the class-level one),
shuts it off, and waits for _get_output passing -
which in turn is hardcoded to use the server id of the class-level
server.
Thus the test was not actually getting the console output
of the server it has just created and shut off, but the class-level one.

To fix this _get_output now accepts optional argument with server id
to check on.

Change-Id: I0f0e48d7e11d2f2f420d106ac8d062c0c56911af
'}]
commit_message:
Fix test_get_console_output_server_id_in_shutoff_status

the test was not actually testing what it was meant to:

it creates its own server (not re-using the class-level one),
shuts it off, and waits for _get_output passing -
which in turn is hardcoded to use the server id of the class-level
server.
Thus the test was not actually getting the console output
of the server it has just created and shut off, but the class-level one.

To fix this _get_output now accepts optional argument with server id
to check on.

Change-Id: I0f0e48d7e11d2f2f420d106ac8d062c0c56911af

found to be needed.

Change-Id: I1e4c9f05c77f2fa64fc962e5e5216a84f29faf52

commit_message:
set PATH to find pip installed tox

We need to be able to find a tox installed with pip, but we don't pick
up /etc/profile where /usr/local/bin is commonly added when running this
in CI. See https://review.opendev.org/#/c/735640/ for where this was
found to be needed.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/739942/
Change-Id: I1e4c9f05c77f2fa64fc962e5e5216a84f29faf52

subject: Add import line unit tests for check_uuid command
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2020-08-02 19:08:33.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/tests/lib/cmd/test_check_uuid.py'], 'message': 'Add import line unit tests for check_uuid command

check_uuid end up adding the import line at the end of the
file if there is no tempest import present in the file.

This is due to:
https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/f2727fa6b4eb9ed3a8b48f6b8a6b0d34d72307fb/tempest/lib/cmd/check_uuid.py#L186-L191
where line_no is passed as 0 to add_patch.

0 line number is never a valid value for add_patch and end
up adding the import line at the end of file.

This commit adds test to cover the expected line number case where
decorator import will be patched in both cases 1. if there is no
tempest import 2. there is tempest import.

Change-Id: I35fe49a6ce2148890c55f279cf8742c0e4332004
Partially-Implements: blueprint tempest-cli-unit-test-coverage
'}]
commit_message:
Add import line unit tests for check_uuid command

check_uuid end up adding the import line at the end of the
file if there is no tempest import present in the file.

This is due to:
https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/f2727fa6b4eb9ed3a8b48f6b8a6b0d34d72307fb/tempest/lib/cmd/check_uuid.py#L186-L191
where line_no is passed as 0 to add_patch.

0 line number is never a valid value for add_patch and end
up adding the import line at the end of file.

This commit adds test to cover the expected line number case where
decorator import will be patched in both cases 1. if there is no
tempest import 2. there is tempest import.

Change-Id: I35fe49a6ce2148890c55f279cf8742c0e4332004
Partially-Implements: blueprint tempest-cli-unit-test-coverage

commit_message:
Remove hard code cidr in test_create_server_multi_nic.

Now, We have some hard code in here, but some VPC are limited to
some specific address ranges by default in some cloud.

So, we need change these hard code to configuration, it can
meet the user specific requirement flexibly and reasonably.

Change-Id: I69c3ac73bda0cc1f0040989c418811cac5254d6a
closes-bug: #1743742

subject: Fallback to certifi-certs if ca_certs is not given
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2020-04-15 17:22:15.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/lib/common/http.py', 'tempest/tests/lib/common/test_http.py'], 'message': 'Fallback to certifi-certs if ca_certs is not given

added workaround for issues with some plugins f.e. octavia/murano
which dont set ca_certs during init.

Since CERT_REQ is the new default in urllib3, this leads to connection
failures caused by client being unable to verify certs.

Closes-Bug: 1872314
Change-Id: Ib7ebb2848a854dddd081666b472916df0998791b
'}]
commit_message:
Fallback to certifi-certs if ca_certs is not given

added workaround for issues with some plugins f.e. octavia/murano
which dont set ca_certs during init.

Since CERT_REQ is the new default in urllib3, this leads to connection
failures caused by client being unable to verify certs.

Closes-Bug: 1872314
Change-Id: Ib7ebb2848a854dddd081666b472916df0998791b

subject: Live Migration: Config_drive enable block live migration
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2019-11-06 20:58:30.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/base.py', 'tempest/api/compute/admin/test_live_migration.py', 'tempest/common/compute.py'], 'message': 'Live Migration: Config_drive enable block live migration

This feature will boot the nova instance using config_drive.
So all the metadata will be stored on config_drive_format
specified in nova.conf like iso9660/vfat and there is
disc.config created on hypervisor for the instance deployed
with config_drive.

Just make sure if we want to use the config_drive testcase then
mention that in tempest.conf with config_drive=true

Related bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1246201

Change-Id: I71f0e60f55c420fe9097bb3d6ab4156c50432264
'}]
commit_message:
Live Migration: Config_drive enable block live migration

This feature will boot the nova instance using config_drive.
So all the metadata will be stored on config_drive_format
specified in nova.conf like iso9660/vfat and there is
disc.config created on hypervisor for the instance deployed
with config_drive.

Just make sure if we want to use the config_drive testcase then
mention that in tempest.conf with config_drive=true

Related bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1246201

Change-Id: I71f0e60f55c420fe9097bb3d6ab4156c50432264

revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2019-09-04 23:26:45.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/cmd/cleanup.py', 'tempest/cmd/cleanup_service.py'], 'message': "[WIP] Add specifiable clean up function

Current clean up relies on a saved_state.json file
and removes all resources that are not in the saved
state. This patch adds the functionality to use a
purge_list.json file that specifies resources to
delete. The purge_list file contains json formated
global resource ids and running 'tempest cleanup --purge-list'
will delete listed global resources and clean up any
global-associated resources. This is aligned with
spec: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/595277/

Change-Id: Icb353bedc3f3e39dde9c2179c369de5d37c16b6e
"}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Add specifiable clean up function

Current clean up relies on a saved_state.json file
and removes all resources that are not in the saved
state. This patch adds the functionality to use a
purge_list.json file that specifies resources to
delete. The purge_list file contains json formated
global resource ids and running 'tempest cleanup --purge-list'
will delete listed global resources and clean up any
global-associated resources. This is aligned with
spec: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/595277/

Change-Id: Icb353bedc3f3e39dde9c2179c369de5d37c16b6e

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2019-09-23 21:56:11.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/scenario/test_server_sev.py', 'tempest/config.py', 'releasenotes/notes/add-amd-sev-scenario-62a5203c5f90b0c0.yaml'], 'message': 'Add tests for basic server operations on AMD SEV compute hosts

Change I6496751fb6657b430ca254818e7f5dd0b1292173 in Nova adds support
for booting guests with hardware-encrypted memory on AMD compute hosts
which have hardware support for SEV (Secure Encrypted Virtualization).

So add some integration tests to check this works.  Obviously the
tests can only be run on AMD compute nodes which support SEV;
therefore a new config option compute-feature-enabled.amd_sev is
introduced which defaults to False.

We (SUSE) hope to add 3rd party CI utilising this at some point.

The tests use the flavor_ref_alt and image_ref_alt configuration
options.

Depends-On: I659cb77f12a38a4d2fb118530ebb9de88d2ed30d
Change-Id: I6496751fb6657b430ca254818e7f5dd0b1292173
'}]
commit_message:
Add tests for basic server operations on AMD SEV compute hosts

Change I6496751fb6657b430ca254818e7f5dd0b1292173 in Nova adds support
for booting guests with hardware-encrypted memory on AMD compute hosts
which have hardware support for SEV (Secure Encrypted Virtualization).

So add some integration tests to check this works.  Obviously the
tests can only be run on AMD compute nodes which support SEV;
therefore a new config option compute-feature-enabled.amd_sev is
introduced which defaults to False.

We (SUSE) hope to add 3rd party CI utilising this at some point.

The tests use the flavor_ref_alt and image_ref_alt configuration
options.

Depends-On: I659cb77f12a38a4d2fb118530ebb9de88d2ed30d
Change-Id: I6496751fb6657b430ca254818e7f5dd0b1292173

commit_message:
Adding tests for Soft Affinity Policies

The current tests for affinity policies only cover affinity and
anti-affinity.  Starting with Microversion 2.15, soft-affinity and
soft-anti affinity policies were added.  These new tests cover
those policies.

Change-Id: Ib50c07ff424a350a9cc383ab6b05c7649f3e3abd

commit_message:
Add new multiattach test to check connectivity

A test is needed that checks whether an instance can still
read a multiattached volume after it is detached from another
instance.

Additionally, this refactors the attach tests somewhat so that
creating multiple clients is easier. More of these checks will
be added in subsequent check-ins.

Related-Bug: 1752115
Depends-On: Idc5cecffa9129d600c36e332c97f01f1e5ff1f9f

Change-Id: Ica87a3c9ec729c52aca0aff6e241868d24796ede

subject: Use tempest run command directly for full job
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2018-09-26 05:28:28.000000000', 'files': ['roles/run-tempest/tasks/main.yaml'], 'message': "Use tempest run command directly for full job

This commit makes to use `tempest run` command directly for the full
job. We currently use tempest run command in tox.ini. However, it's
good to use the command directly in case of changing tox.ini to use
the other command such as stestr to run tempest tests.

And also, this patch keeps the original tox call because all regexes
need to be copy to the main.yaml which is too redundant if we want to
run tempest run command for all of the jobs.

Change-Id: Ibc27340d29fbc961704e6ee70b3fb4212414ad60
"}]
commit_message:
Use tempest run command directly for full job

This commit makes to use `tempest run` command directly for the full
job. We currently use tempest run command in tox.ini. However, it's
good to use the command directly in case of changing tox.ini to use
the other command such as stestr to run tempest tests.

And also, this patch keeps the original tox call because all regexes
need to be copy to the main.yaml which is too redundant if we want to
run tempest run command for all of the jobs.

Change-Id: Ibc27340d29fbc961704e6ee70b3fb4212414ad60

commit_message:
Add testcase for getting hypervisor servers in 2.53

list_servers_on_hypervisor and search_hypervisor are
deprecated in microversion 2.52, and list_hypervisors with
with_servers and hypervisor_hostname_pattern should be used
instead, so this is to add testcase for getting specified
hypervisor and hypervisor servers.

Change-Id: I1ff82e3794facdb67d8308ddd3f3f5e75dcece54

commit_message:
Refactor is_resource_deleted method

This commit refactors is_resource_deleted method in rest_client. In many
cases, is_resource_deleted was overridden with same simple logic. So
this commit just extracts the logic.

Change-Id: I95a521acc9bf6bcaacb9487b95ff4c5fb3b5cd72

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-06-11 06:23:53.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/tests/common/test_waiters.py'], 'message': 'Fix test_wait_for_interface_status and detach

This commit fixes a test test_wait_for_interface_{status,detach} in
TestInterfaceWaiters. The test is checking the time for
wait_for_interface_{status,detach} methods. The assumption is that
the start_time and end_time must be same. However, they could be
different in some rare cases such as if a start_time is almost
changing to the next second, the end_time can be the next second[0].

[0] http://paste.openstack.org/show/722951/

Change-Id: I4ebea774f00852fa6fd147dedfbfa5ebb8c1ff31
'}]
commit_message:
Fix test_wait_for_interface_status and detach

This commit fixes a test test_wait_for_interface_{status,detach} in
TestInterfaceWaiters. The test is checking the time for
wait_for_interface_{status,detach} methods. The assumption is that
the start_time and end_time must be same. However, they could be
different in some rare cases such as if a start_time is almost
changing to the next second, the end_time can be the next second[0].

[0] http://paste.openstack.org/show/722951/

Change-Id: I4ebea774f00852fa6fd147dedfbfa5ebb8c1ff31
